study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the long-term safety of entecavir, focusing on adverse events potentially associated with nucleos(t)ide analogs, including effects on alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels.
results_summary: Long-term entecavir administration showed low rates of serious adverse events (AEs), discontinuations due to AEs, and ALT flares. Most AEs were mild to moderate, with infrequent occurrences of nucleos(t)ide-associated AEs like myalgia and neuropathy.
population_specificity: Chronic hepatitis B patients previously treated with entecavir, lamivudine, or adefovir monotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the biochemical properties of AGT allelic forms and PH1-causing variants to understand the molecular basis of PH1 pathogenesis and predict treatment responses.
results_summary: The study highlights the effects of pathogenic mutations on AGT protein function, improving understanding of PH1 pathogenesis and aiding in predicting pyridoxine treatment responses or suggesting new therapeutic strategies.
population_specificity: Patients with Primary Hyperoxaluria Type 1 (PH1) caused by AGXT gene mutations.

study_goal: The researchers compared the effectiveness of lamivudine (LAM) and entecavir (ETV) in treating acute exacerbation of chronic hepatitis B with elevated alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels.
results_summary: Both LAM and ETV showed high initial virological response rates (83.3% and 100%, respectively), with no significant reduction in HBV DNA after 1 or 3 months. ETV-treated patients did not require drug changes, unlike 41.6% of LAM-treated patients who developed resistance.
population_specificity: Patients with acute exacerbation of chronic hepatitis B and ALT levels ≥500 IU/L.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effectiveness of the American Thoracic Society risk-factor approach versus uniform liver function testing at 2 weeks for predicting drug-induced liver injury in tuberculosis patients.
results_summary: The study found that the American Thoracic Society algorithm had limited sensitivity and specificity for predicting drug-induced liver injury, while uniform liver function testing at 2 weeks was more specific but less sensitive for late injury. Early drug-induced liver injury was more common in HIV-infected individuals.
population_specificity: Adult patients undergoing therapy for active tuberculosis at a tertiary center, including a significant proportion with HIV infection.
study_duration: Liver function was monitored at baseline and 2 weeks after therapy commencement.

study_goal: The study aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of vatalanib in untreated malignant mesothelioma patients, not specifically Alanine.
results_summary: Elevated alanine aminotransferase (11%) was noted as a grade 3/4 adverse event, but the study did not focus on Alanine's effects.
population_specificity: Previously untreated patients with malignant mesothelioma (median age 75, 79% ECOG performance status 1).
effective_dosage: Not applicable (study focused on vatalanib, not Alanine).
study_duration: Not applicable (study focused on vatalanib, not Alanine).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to reassess causality levels between Greater Celandine (GC) use and liver injury, focusing on alanine aminotransferase changes and confounding variables.
results_summary: The study found that GC hepatotoxicity was highly probable or probable in 8 out of 21 cases, with the remaining cases showing lower causality. The reaction was identified as idiosyncratic metabolic, lacking immunologic or obligatory hepatotoxic features.
population_specificity: Patients with reported liver injury linked to Greater Celandine use (21 cases).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify risk factors for hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) in patients with autoimmune hepatitis (AIH), focusing on the role of abnormal alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels.
results_summary: The study found that abnormal ALT at final observation was an independent risk factor for HCC development in AIH patients, alongside cirrhosis at diagnosis. Normalizing ALT was emphasized as important for reducing HCC risk.
population_specificity: 180 patients diagnosed with AIH in Japan (159 female, 21 male; mean age 59.9 years).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether genetic variations, including those affecting alanine (specifically the SLCO1B1 rs4149056 SNP involving a valine-for-alanine substitution), influence LDL cholesterol lowering with pravastatin.
results_summary: The study found that the rs4149056 SNP (valine for alanine at position 174 in SLCO1B1) was associated with significantly reduced LDL cholesterol lowering response to pravastatin, while the rs2306283 SNP (asparagine for aspartic acid at position 130) showed no effect.
population_specificity: 5,411 elderly participants (mean age 75.3 years) at risk for cardiovascular disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effects of vitamin D supplementation on inflammatory biomarkers, including alanine aminotransferase (ALT), in overweight and obese adults undergoing resistance exercise training.
results_summary: The study found no significant changes in circulating ALT levels after 12 weeks of vitamin D supplementation combined with resistance training, indicating no effect on this biomarker.
population_specificity: Overweight and obese adults (BMI 31.3 ± 3.2 kg/m², aged 26.1 ± 4.7 years).
effective_dosage: Not applicable (study focused on vitamin D, not alanine dosage).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the role of adipose tissue insulin resistance in metabolic and histological abnormalities in obese patients with NAFLD, including the relationship with alanine aminotransferase levels.
results_summary: The study found that patients with NAFLD had higher plasma alanine aminotransferase levels compared to controls, indicating liver dysfunction, and these levels worsened with increasing adipose tissue insulin resistance. However, the abstract does not specifically evaluate alanine's effects as a supplement or therapeutic agent.
population_specificity: 207 obese patients with NAFLD (BMI = 34.1 ± 0.3 kg/m²) and 22 controls without NAFLD.

study_goal: The study does not focus on Alanine but rather on the development and approval of crizotinib for ALK-rearranged NSCLC.
results_summary: The study does not report any findings related to Alanine.
population_specificity: ALK-rearranged NSCLC patients.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the efficacy and tolerability of PEG-IFN-α2A in chronic hepatitis B (CHB) patients in a clinical setting, focusing on outcomes like ALT normalization, viral suppression, and HBeAg seroconversion.
results_summary: The study found that PEG-IFN-α2A was well tolerated, with 6.5% discontinuing due to adverse events. Efficacy varied: 46% of HBeAg-positive patients achieved ALT normalization, 16% had viral loads <351 IU/mL, and 32% achieved HBeAg seroconversion; HBeAg-negative patients showed 55% ALT normalization and 36% viral suppression.
population_specificity: Chronic hepatitis B patients (HBeAg-positive and HBeAg-negative), predominantly male and of Asian origin, treated at tertiary hospitals.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the beneficial and harmful effects of interferon alpha for patients with chronic hepatitis D, including its impact on virologic, biochemical, and histological responses.
results_summary: Interferon alpha showed some efficacy in suppressing viral and liver disease activity, but the benefits were not sustained in most patients. Adverse events were common and sometimes severe, with no significant histological improvement observed.
population_specificity: Patients with chronic hepatitis D infection (201 participants, predominantly male).
effective_dosage: Higher and lower doses of interferon alpha were compared, but specific amounts and frequencies are not detailed in the abstract.
study_duration: Follow-up included end of treatment and six months or more post-treatment, but exact intervention duration is not specified.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the therapeutic efficacy of Peg-IFN alfa-2a and Peg-IFN alfa-2b with ribavirin in treating chronic hepatitis C (CHC) patients with HCV genotype 1b, focusing on virological and biochemical responses, including alanine transaminase (ALT) levels.
results_summary: The study found that both Peg-IFN alfa-2a and Peg-IFN alfa-2b with ribavirin significantly reduced HCV-RNA and ALT levels, with no significant differences between the two treatments. Sustained virological response (SVR) was achieved in 48.3% and 44.3% of patients, respectively.
population_specificity: 260 adult patients with chronic hepatitis C and HCV genotype 1b from the south of Poland.
effective_dosage: Not specified (Peg-IFN alfa-2a or Peg-IFN alfa-2b with ribavirin for 48 weeks).
study_duration: 48 weeks of therapy, with follow-up at 72 weeks.

study_goal: The study does not focus on Alanine; it evaluates the efficacy and safety of pitavastatin in clinical practice.
results_summary: The study does not report findings related to Alanine.
population_specificity: Japanese patients with hypercholesterolemia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of thiadiazolidinone inhibitors targeting alanine racemase (Alr) as a therapeutic agent against MRSA.
results_summary: The thiadiazolidinone series effectively inhibited Alr activity (IC₅₀ 0.36–6.4 μM) and showed antimicrobial activity against S. aureus, including MRSA strains (MICs 6.25–100 μg/ml), but also inhibited human HeLa cell proliferation, indicating potential toxicity.
population_specificity: In vitro study targeting MRSA and human HeLa cells.
effective_dosage: IC₅₀ 0.36–6.4 μM for enzyme inhibition; MICs 6.25–100 μg/ml for bacterial growth inhibition.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if early lactate clearance could serve as an accurate predictor for initial poor graft function (IPGF) following liver transplantation, with a focus on alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels as a marker.
results_summary: The study found that early lactate clearance was significantly higher in the non-IPGF group (43.2%) compared to the IPGF group (13.4%), with a cut-off value of 24.8% predicting IPGF with high sensitivity (95.5%) and specificity (88.9%). Patients with lactate clearance ≤24.8% had a 169-fold higher risk of IPGF and a 3.6-fold higher risk of in-hospital mortality.
population_specificity: 222 patients referred to the surgical intensive care unit (SICU) after orthotopic liver transplantation.
study_duration: Lactate levels were measured at SICU presentation (hour 0) and at hour 6 post-transplant.

study_goal: The researchers investigated whether IL28B genotypes are associated with treatment response to peginterferon alfa (PEG-IFN) in HBeAg-positive chronic hepatitis B patients.
results_summary: IL28B genotypes were significantly associated with HBeAg seroconversion at the end of treatment and during long-term follow-up, as well as hepatitis B surface antigen clearance. Similar results were observed for both rs12980275 and rs12979860 polymorphisms.
population_specificity: HBeAg-positive chronic hepatitis B patients (205 participants from 11 European and Asian hospitals).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the incidence, temporal trends, and clinical significance of liver enzyme elevations (including alanine transaminase, ALT) in patients with ST-segment elevation myocardial infarction (STEMI).
results_summary: Elevated ALT was common (48.2% of patients) and correlated with CK-MB levels. ALT elevations were independently associated with worse mortality and clinical outcomes, even after adjusting for CK-MB.
population_specificity: 1903 patients with STEMI from two clinical trials.
study_duration: Measurements taken at baseline, days 1, 6, and 14.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of IVMP+IVIG combination therapy for refractory Kawasaki disease (KD), using the Egami score (which includes alanine aminotransferase levels) to predict refractory cases.
results_summary: The study found that IVMP+IVIG therapy resulted in prompt defervescence in 86.4% of predicted refractory KD patients, compared to 23.1% with IVIG alone. No serious adverse events were reported in either group.
population_specificity: 122 patients with Kawasaki disease, including 48 predicted to have refractory KD based on the Egami score.
effective_dosage: Not specified for alanine aminotransferase (used as a predictive marker, not a treatment).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety, pharmacokinetics, and antitumor activity of ispinesib, including its effects on alanine aminotransferase levels in patients with advanced breast cancer.
results_summary: The study found that increased alanine aminotransferase was a common toxicity (56%), with dose-limiting toxicity observed at 12 mg/m². Disease stabilization occurred in 73.3% of patients, but antitumor activity was limited (7% response rate).
population_specificity: Patients with locally advanced or metastatic breast cancer who had received prior neoadjuvant or adjuvant chemotherapy.
effective_dosage: 10 mg/m² (n=3), 12 mg/m² (n=6), and 14 mg/m² (n=7), administered as a 1-hour infusion on days 1 and 15 every 28 days.
study_duration: Until toxicity or disease progression (exact duration not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare serum biochemistry levels, including alanine aminotransferase (ALT), between breast-fed and formula-fed infants at 4 and 8 weeks of age.
results_summary: Serum ALT levels were significantly higher in breast-fed infants compared to formula-fed infants at both 4 and 8 weeks of age, indicating a metabolic difference influenced by nutrition source.
population_specificity: Healthy 4-week-old and 8-week-old infants (30 breast-fed, 30 formula-fed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the accuracy of transient elastography (TE) for assessing liver fibrosis in chronic HBV and HCV patients and evaluate the impact of alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels on TE performance.
results_summary: TE showed comparable diagnostic accuracy for liver fibrosis in HBV and HCV patients, with no significant influence of ALT levels on TE performance in HBV individuals. ALT-specific cut-off values did not improve diagnostic performance for fibrosis prediction in HBV patients.
population_specificity: Treatment-naïve patients with compensated chronic HBV or HCV infection.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential benefits of antioxidant therapy, including Alanine, in managing liver diseases such as chronic hepatitis C, alcoholic liver disease, and NASH.
results_summary: The study found mixed results for antioxidant therapy, with the most promising outcomes for vitamin E in NASH and some encouraging results for acute alcoholic hepatitis. However, there was no convincing evidence that antioxidant therapy, including Alanine, significantly benefits chronic hepatitis C patients.
population_specificity: Patients with chronic hepatitis C, alcoholic liver disease, and non-alcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the potential of metadoxine (which includes alanine) as a pharmacotherapy for alcohol dependence, particularly in patients with alcoholic liver disease.
results_summary: The study found significant reductions in alcohol consumption, craving (measured by VAS), and improvements in liver-related biomarkers (AST/ALT ratio). A majority of patients (67.3%) achieved complete abstinence during follow-up.
population_specificity: 94 outpatients with alcohol dependence, some with alcoholic liver disease.

study_goal: The researchers evaluated the clinical impact of abnormal liver or muscle enzyme results, including alanine aminotransferase, in statin-treated patients.
results_summary: The study found that routine follow-up enzyme tests for statin-treated patients had little practical value, with treatment changes more likely in symptomatic patients, particularly those with musculoskeletal symptoms.
population_specificity: 408 statin-treated patients (average age 63.8 ± 10.9 years) with at least one enzyme level > 10% normal.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify epitopes recognized by IgG in MS CSF, using alanine scan mutagenesis to analyze peptide binding specificity.
results_summary: The study identified peptides derived from proteins including serine/threonine-protein kinase, protein ZIP2, and MHC class II, recognized by OCBs in MS CSF, suggesting potential diagnostic and therapeutic targets. Alanine scan mutagenesis was used to confirm linear epitopes.
population_specificity: 5 MS patients

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the long-term efficacy and safety of adefovir dipivoxil (ADV) treatment in HBeAg-positive chronic hepatitis B (CHB) patients, focusing on virological, serological, and biochemical responses.
results_summary: Five years of ADV treatment led to sustained suppression of HBV DNA, increasing rates of undetectable HBV DNA (from 28% to 58%) and HBeAg seroconversion (from 11% to 29%), with maintained ALT normalization in 75-79% of subjects. Virological resistance occurred in 14.6% of patients, necessitating urgent switch or add-on therapy if detected.
population_specificity: Chinese subjects with HBeAg-positive chronic hepatitis B (CHB).
study_duration: 5 years (initial 1-year double-blind study followed by 208-week open-label continuation).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether folic acid (FA) supplementation could reduce serum alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels in hypertensive Chinese adults.
results_summary: The study found that a high dose of FA (0.8 mg) combined with enalapril significantly reduced ALT levels, particularly in men and participants with elevated baseline ALT (>40 IU/l), while the low FA dose showed no difference compared to the control group.
population_specificity: Hypertensive Chinese adults without known hepatic disease.
effective_dosage: 0.4 mg FA (low dose) or 0.8 mg FA (high dose) combined with 10 mg enalapril, once daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the long-term clinical effects of metreleptin on glycemic and lipid abnormalities, including markers of hepatic steatosis (ALT and AST), in patients with lipodystrophy.
results_summary: Metreleptin treatment led to sustained reductions in hemoglobin A1c, triglycerides, ALT, and AST levels over a 3-year period, with more pronounced improvements in patients with elevated baseline levels. Adverse events were likely linked to underlying metabolic conditions rather than the treatment itself.
population_specificity: 55 patients (36 with generalized lipodystrophy, 19 with partial lipodystrophy) with metabolic abnormalities (diabetes, high triglycerides, or insulin resistance) and low leptin levels.
effective_dosage: Subcutaneous injections once or twice daily (specific dosage not provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the potential role of beta-N-methylamino-L-alanine (BMAA), a non-protein amino acid, as an environmental factor in neurodegenerative diseases like ALS.
results_summary: The study found that BMAA has toxic effects on motor neurons, including receptor agonism, oxidative stress induction, and glutathione depletion, and may contribute to protein misfolding, a hallmark of neurodegeneration. While an animal model for BMAA-induced ALS is lacking, substantial evidence supports a link between BMAA and ALS.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion of neurodegenerative disease mechanisms)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of silymarin (not Alanine) in patients with chronic hepatitis C who failed conventional antiviral therapy.
results_summary: The abstract does not report specific results regarding Alanine's effects, as the study focused on silymarin. Key aspects of botanical product trials were highlighted, including product standardization and outcome variable selection.
population_specificity: Chronic hepatitis C patients who were nonsustained virologic responders to IFN-based therapy.

study_goal: The researchers compared clinical and laboratory findings between hepatitis A and scrub typhus patients, focusing on alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels as a diagnostic marker.
results_summary: Elevated ALT levels (≥ 500 U/L) were far more common in hepatitis A patients (87.5%) than in scrub typhus patients (1%). The ALT:lactate dehydrogenase ratio also effectively differentiated the two conditions.
population_specificity: 104 hepatitis A patients and 197 scrub typhus patients.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the prevalence of insulin resistance (IR) and its associations with metabolic and clinical factors, including alanine aminotransferase levels, in HIV-infected children.
results_summary: The study found that IR was associated with higher alanine aminotransferase levels, among other factors, in HIV-infected children, but did not specifically assess alanine's direct effects or safety.
population_specificity: HIV-infected children from the Pediatric HIV/AIDS Cohort Study (n=451).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the clinical effectiveness of insulin sensitisers, including metformin and pioglitazone, in treating NAFLD, with a focus on their impact on alanine aminotransferase levels.
results_summary: Both metformin and pioglitazone reduced alanine aminotransferase levels, though pioglitazone's reduction was comparable to that caused by vitamin E. Metformin showed greater improvements in glycemic control and weight reduction compared to pioglitazone.
population_specificity: Patients with non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD).
study_duration: Most trials lasted between 6 and 12 months.

study_goal: The researchers were attempting to determine the efficacy and safety of alternative antifungal combination treatments for HIV-associated cryptococcal meningitis, including regimens involving fluconazole and voriconazole, compared to the standard amphotericin B plus flucytosine therapy.
results_summary: The study found no statistically significant differences in the rate of clearance of cryptococcal infection or mortality among the four treatment groups, including those involving fluconazole or voriconazole. No significant increases in alanine transaminase levels or other severe laboratory abnormalities were observed.
population_specificity: HIV-seropositive, antiretroviral-naive patients with cryptococcal meningitis.
effective_dosage: Not applicable (study focused on antifungal combinations, not alanine).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the association between alanine aminotransferase (ALT) and insulin resistance (HOMA-IR) in postmenopausal women.
results_summary: The study found that alanine aminotransferase (ALT) was one of the important determinants of HOMA-IR in postmenopausal women, suggesting a link between ALT levels and insulin resistance. However, the abstract does not specify the direct effects of alanine supplementation.
population_specificity: Naturally postmenopausal women without overt diabetes (n=262).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether L-alanine supplementation influenced deoxysphingolipid (dSL) levels and disease severity in HSAN1, given its role as an alternative substrate for mutant SPT.
results_summary: A 10% L-alanine–enriched diet increased dSL levels and led to severe peripheral neuropathy in mice with HSAN1, demonstrating its detrimental effects. The study suggests L-alanine exacerbates the disease by promoting neurotoxic dSL formation.
population_specificity: Mice with a transgene expressing the C133W SPTLC1 mutant linked to HSAN1; a pilot study with 14 HSAN1 patients (for L-serine, not L-alanine).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate reinfection and superinfection during treatment for recent hepatitis C virus (HCV) and assess the role of alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels as a clinical marker.
results_summary: The study found that reinfection and superinfection occurred during HCV treatment, with ALT levels >1.5× the upper limit of normal observed in 71% of reinfection cases. These events were associated with poor social functioning and ongoing injecting drug use (IDU).
population_specificity: 163 patients with recent HCV infection, including treated (n=111) and untreated (n=52) groups.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if salivary alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels could predict the progression of periodontitis.
results_summary: The study found that ALT levels, when combined with the P. gingivalis ratio, showed high specificity (0.96) and likelihood (11.30) for predicting periodontitis progression.
population_specificity: 85 chronic periodontitis patients.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of omega-3 PUFA supplementation on liver fat and liver function tests, including alanine aminotransferase (ALT), in individuals with NAFLD.
results_summary: Omega-3 PUFA supplementation showed significant benefits in reducing liver fat and AST levels, with a non-significant trend toward improving ALT levels. Sub-analyses of RCTs confirmed the liver fat reduction but not ALT or AST improvements.
population_specificity: Obese individuals with NAFLD (355 participants across 9 studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the therapeutic response and hepatic functional reserve improvement in HCV-associated HCC patients receiving PEG-IFN a-2b/RBV therapy after curative treatment.
results_summary: The study found that PEG-IFN a-2b/RBV therapy improved cumulative survival rates (100% at 1 year, 90.2% at 3 years) and hepatic functional reserve in HCV-associated HCC patients compared to the non-treatment group. Univariate analysis identified secondary IFN treatment, alanine aminotransferase, and albumin levels as factors contributing to survival.
population_specificity: 54 patients with initial HCV-associated Stage I/II HCC (29 treated with PEG-IFN a-2b/RBV, 25 untreated).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of a probiotic mixture (Lactobacillus bulgaricus and Streptococcus thermophilus) on liver function markers, including alanine aminotransferase (ALT), in patients with non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD).
results_summary: The probiotic treatment significantly reduced ALT, AST, and gammaGT levels in NAFLD patients, while placebo showed no significant changes. Anthropometric and cardiovascular risk factors remained unchanged in both groups.
population_specificity: 28 patients with NAFLD diagnosed by liver biopsy.
effective_dosage: 500 million Lactobacillus bulgaricus and Streptococcus thermophilus per day (one tablet).

study_goal: The study aimed to compare the efficacy and safety of elvitegravir versus raltegravir in treatment-experienced HIV patients, not specifically to evaluate alanine.
results_summary: The study found that elvitegravir had similar efficacy and safety to raltegravir, with more patients on raltegravir experiencing grade 3 or 4 rises in alanine aminotransferase. Alanine itself was not the focus of the study.
population_specificity: Treatment-experienced HIV patients with resistance to or experience with at least two classes of antiretroviral drugs.
effective_dosage: Not applicable (study did not focus on alanine dosage).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the scientific review of pazopanib's application for treating advanced renal cell carcinoma, including its safety and efficacy.
results_summary: Pazopanib increased progression-free survival to 9.2 months compared to 4.2 months with placebo, but common side effects included elevated alanine aminotransferase and other adverse events.
population_specificity: Patients with advanced renal cell carcinoma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the incidence of hyperlactatemia and lactic acidosis in HIV-exposed infants and assess any associations with neurological or neurodevelopmental disorders, using alanine levels as part of the diagnostic criteria.
results_summary: The study found no significant association between ARV use and pathological hyperlactatemia or neurological disorders in HIV-exposed infants. Hyperlactatemia was common in both HIV-exposed and unexposed infants, with no link to adverse neurological outcomes.
population_specificity: Infants born to HIV-infected mothers and infants born to HCV-infected mothers during their first year of life.
study_duration: Follow-up at 1.5, 3, 6, and 12 months of life.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of teriflunomide, including its impact on alanine aminotransferase levels, in patients with relapsing forms of multiple sclerosis.
results_summary: Teriflunomide increased the incidence of elevated alanine aminotransferase levels (54.0% and 57.3% for 7 mg and 14 mg doses, respectively) compared to placebo (35.9%), but severe elevations (≥3 times the upper limit) were similar across groups. No deaths occurred, and serious infections were rare.
population_specificity: Patients with relapsing multiple sclerosis, aged 18-55, with an Expanded Disability Status Scale score of 0-5.5 and recent relapse history.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify a novel mutation in the androgen receptor gene (AR) involving an alanine substitution and its association with mild androgen insensitivity syndrome (MAIS) and azoospermia.
results_summary: The study identified a novel mutation (A240S) in the AR gene, resulting in an alanine to serine substitution, linked to MAIS and azoospermia. Hormonal evaluation showed normal testosterone but elevated gonadotropins in the patient.
population_specificity: A 49-year-old man with undermasculinized features, cryptorchidism, and azoospermia.

study_goal: The researchers investigated whether weight loss in excessively obese adults improves cardiometabolic risk factors, including alanine aminotransferase levels.
results_summary: Weight loss correlated with significant improvements in alanine aminotransferase levels, among other cardiometabolic markers. The greatest improvements were seen with ≥ 20% weight loss.
population_specificity: Excessively obese adults (BMI 40-60 kg/m²), including 48 with type 2 diabetes mellitus.
study_duration: Followed during 2005-2008 (exact intervention duration not specified)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of MK-0633, a 5-lipoxygenase inhibitor, in patients with chronic asthma, including its impact on alanine aminotransferase levels.
results_summary: MK-0633 100 mg showed significant improvement in FEV(1) and other secondary endpoints compared to placebo, but it was associated with dose-dependent increases in alanine aminotransferase, leading to termination of extended study periods due to an unfavorable benefit-risk ratio.
population_specificity: Patients aged 18-70 with chronic asthma and FEV(1) ≥45% and ≤85% predicted.
effective_dosage: 10 mg, 50 mg, and 100 mg once daily.
study_duration: 6-week primary period, with optional extensions up to 52 weeks (terminated early).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels as a biomarker for identifying chronic hepatitis B (CHB) patients who are candidates for antiviral therapy.
results_summary: The study found that elevated ALT levels, along with HBV DNA levels >10⁴ copies/mL, are key indicators for initiating antiviral therapy in CHB patients. It also highlighted specific conditions (e.g., serum albumin ≤3.5 g/dL, platelet count ≤130,000 mm³) where treatment is recommended even with normal ALT levels.
population_specificity: Asian Americans with chronic hepatitis B (HBeAg-positive or -negative).

study_goal: The study assessed the activity and safety of eribulin in patients with different types of soft-tissue sarcoma, not Alanine.
results_summary: The study found that eribulin showed varying progression-free survival rates at 12 weeks across different sarcoma types, with common adverse events including neutropenia and leucopenia. Abnormal alanine aminotransferase concentrations were noted in 5% of patients.
population_specificity: Patients with progressive or high-grade soft-tissue sarcoma (adipocytic sarcoma, leiomyosarcoma, synovial sarcoma, and other sarcomas).
effective_dosage: Eribulin was given intravenously at 1.4 mg/m² on days 1 and 8 every 3 weeks.
study_duration: Treatment cycles were every 3 weeks; specific total duration not stated.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare hepatic, gastrointestinal, and cardiac toxicity between PRECISION TACE with drug-eluting beads (DEB) and conventional TACE with doxorubicin in treating intermediate-stage hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC).
results_summary: The study found that PRECISION TACE with DEB resulted in significantly lower increases in alanine transaminase (50% less) and aspartate transaminase (41% less) compared to conventional TACE, with fewer liver toxicity events (16.1% vs. 25%). There was also a small but significant difference in cardiac function (LVEF change of 4 percentage points favoring DEB TACE).
population_specificity: 212 patients (185 men, 27 women; mean age 67 years) with intermediate-stage HCC, predominantly in advanced stages (67% in both groups).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the association between immune responses and liver enzyme elevation (specifically alanine transaminase) in HIV and hepatitis C co-infected patients during combination antiretroviral therapy.
results_summary: The study found that subjects with liver enzyme elevation had higher immune responses against hepatitis C virus and other viral antigens, as well as consistently higher anti-hepatitis C virus antibody levels, suggesting a link between immune reconstitution and liver transaminase elevation.
population_specificity: 12 subjects with HIV and hepatitis C virus co-infection, five of whom had alanine transaminase elevation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the clinical and laboratory determinants of liver stiffness, measured by transient elastography, in rheumatoid arthritis patients treated with methotrexate, focusing on factors like alanine transaminase levels.
results_summary: The study found a significant correlation between liver stiffness and methotrexate cumulative dose, duration of treatment, and alanine transaminase levels, with mild or moderate fibrosis detected in some patients with high cumulative doses and liver stiffness >9 kPa.
population_specificity: 100 patients with rheumatoid arthritis treated with methotrexate.
effective_dosage: Cumulative methotrexate dose ranging from 1530 to 13,000 mg.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety profile of caspofungin (CAS) in adult and paediatric patients across various clinical conditions.
results_summary: The study found that 41.8% of CAS recipients experienced drug-related adverse events, with the most common being fever, chills, and increased liver enzymes. Serious AEs were rare (0.8% attributed to CAS), and discontinuation due to AEs was infrequent (2.7%).
population_specificity: Adult and paediatric patients, including those with oropharyngeal/oesophageal candidiasis, invasive candidiasis, invasive aspergillosis, and persistent fever with neutropenia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of caloric restriction alone or combined with exercise on liver enzymes (including alanine aminotransferase, ALT) in obese metabolic syndrome subjects and identify predictors of changes in these enzymes.
results_summary: ALT levels decreased by 20% with caloric restriction and 24% with caloric restriction plus exercise, indicating significant improvement. Reduction in abdominal fat mass and dietary saturated fat intake were key predictors of ALT improvement.
population_specificity: Sedentary men and women aged 55 ± 6 years with obesity and metabolic syndrome.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the adverse-event risks, including alanine aminotransferase (ALT) elevations, across different statins used for cardiovascular disease prevention.
results_summary: The study found that statins, as a class, significantly elevated ALT levels compared to controls (OR: 1.28; 95% CI: 1.11-1.48). Atorvastatin specifically showed higher AST elevations compared to pravastatin.
population_specificity: 159,458 patients from 72 randomized clinical trials focused on cardiovascular disease prevention.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to validate the APRI (aspartate aminotransferase-to-platelet ratio index) as a non-invasive marker for liver fibrosis in NAFLD patients, comparing it to NFS and AST/ALT ratio.
results_summary: APRI showed higher sensitivity (75%) and specificity (86%) for detecting advanced fibrosis compared to NFS, with a superior positive predictive value (54% vs. 34%). The study concluded APRI is a favorable alternative for fibrosis prediction in NAFLD.
population_specificity: 111 patients with histological diagnoses of NAFLD, grouped into FLD, NASH, no/mild fibrosis, and advanced fibrosis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the clinical outcomes, including liver injury markers (AST and ALT), between hemihepatic vascular occlusion (HHO) and total hepatic inflow occlusion (THO) in patients undergoing hepatectomy.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in blood loss, transfusion requirement, mortality, morbidity, or other clinical outcomes between HHO and THO groups. However, THO was associated with higher AST levels on postoperative day 1, indicating greater liver injury compared to HHO.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing hepatic resection (338 participants across 4 RCTs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze and compile laboratory abnormalities, including alanine aminotransferase levels, in patients with Myotonic Dystrophy Type 2 (DM2).
results_summary: The study found that alanine aminotransferase levels were abnormally elevated in more than 50% of DM2 patients, indicating potential liver involvement or dysfunction. No direct effects or benefits of alanine supplementation were assessed.
population_specificity: Eighty-three adults with genetically confirmed or clinically probable DM2, of which 49 had documented baseline laboratory screening.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of PEG-interferon α-2a and weight-based ribavirin doses in patients with chronic hepatitis C and persistently normal alanine transaminase levels.
results_summary: The study found an 85.4% sustained virological response (SVR) rate, with higher efficacy in patients with "easy" genotypes (92.2%) compared to "difficult" genotypes (74.3%). Female patients with easy genotypes had a 100% SVR rate.
population_specificity: Patients with chronic hepatitis C and persistently normal alanine transaminase levels (227 participants, 55 men and 172 women).
effective_dosage: PEG-interferon α-2a 180 mg/week and ribavirin (800 mg/day for weight <60 kg; 1000 mg/day for weight >60 and <75 kg; 1200 mg/day for weight >75 kg).
study_duration: 24 weeks for genotype 2 or 3, 48 weeks for genotype 1 or 4.

study_goal: The researchers compared the safety and efficacy of two different schedules (CG1 and CG8) of gemcitabine and carboplatin in treating advanced non-small cell lung cancer, not specifically focused on Alanine.
results_summary: The study found that CG1 had a higher response rate (29.2%) compared to CG8 (22.2%), but CG8 showed improved toxicities and a tendency toward prolonged survival. Grade ≥3 liver enzyme elevations (including alanine aminotransferase) were mainly observed in CG8.
population_specificity: Patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer.

study_goal: The study does not focus on Alanine but rather evaluates micafungin's safety, efficacy, and dosing in children for invasive fungal infections.
results_summary: The study does not report findings on Alanine; it discusses micafungin's antifungal activity, dosing, and adverse effects, including elevation of alanine aminotransferase/aspartate aminotransferase values.
population_specificity: Immunocompromised children with invasive fungal infections or at risk for such infections.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the diagnostic performance of alanine aminotransferase (ALT) as a biomarker for chronic alcohol misuse compared to other indirect and direct biomarkers.
results_summary: ALT was found to be highly correlated with AST but exhibited low sensitivity and specificity in discriminating heavy drinkers from social and non-drinkers, suggesting limited diagnostic utility for chronic alcohol abuse.
population_specificity: 175 subjects classified as non-drinkers (N=65), social drinkers (N=51), and active heavy drinkers (N=59).

study_goal: The researchers were attempting to evaluate the feasibility and safety of using ¹²⁵I seed strands for intraluminal brachytherapy (ILBT) in treating malignant obstructive jaundice (MOJ) and its effect on stent patency, not Alanine.
results_summary: The study found that ILBT with ¹²⁵I seed strands prolonged stent patency (10.2 months vs. 7.2 months in controls) without significant differences in serum bilirubin, alanine aminotransferase, granulocytes, or platelets between groups.
population_specificity: 34 patients with malignant obstructive jaundice (MOJ).
effective_dosage: Not applicable (study focused on ¹²⁵I seed strands, not Alanine).
study_duration: Follow-up at 2 and 4 weeks post-procedure; stent patency monitored over months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of Bifidobacterium longum with fructo-oligosaccharides (Fos) combined with lifestyle modification on non-alcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH) compared to lifestyle modification alone.
results_summary: The study found that Bifidobacterium longum with Fos and lifestyle modification significantly reduced AST, LDL cholesterol, CRP, TNF-α, HOMA-IR, serum endotoxin, steatosis, and the NASH activity index compared to lifestyle modification alone.
population_specificity: 66 patients with non-alcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH).

study_goal: The researchers investigated the clinical and histologic features of NAFLD, including alanine aminotransferase levels, in Korean young men.
results_summary: The study found that most Korean young men with NAFLD had borderline or definite NASH, with the overlap type showing higher NAS and fibrosis stages compared to other types. Alanine aminotransferase levels were significantly higher in the definite NASH group.
population_specificity: Korean young men under age 30 diagnosed with NAFLD by liver biopsy.

study_goal: The study aimed to compare the clinical features, recurrence rates, and survival outcomes of early-stage cryptogenic cirrhosis-associated hepatocellular carcinoma (CC-HCC) versus HCV-associated HCC (HCV-HCC), with a focus on prognostic factors including alanine aminotransferase levels.
results_summary: CC-HCC patients had larger tumors but lower recurrence rates and higher survival rates compared to HCV-HCC patients. High alanine aminotransferase levels were a significant factor for recurrence in HCV-HCC but not in CC-HCC.
population_specificity: Patients with early-stage hepatocellular carcinoma (36 CC-HCC and 211 HCV-HCC) who received curative treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether alanine transaminase (ALT) levels could serve as a prognostic indicator for short-term survival (two weeks) in patients with advanced cancer.
results_summary: The study found that alanine transaminase (ALT) was one of four variables with prognostic significance for two-week survival in advanced cancer patients, though it did not predict longer-term survival. The composite models incorporating ALT performed comparably or better than clinicians' survival estimates.
population_specificity: 1018 patients with locally advanced or metastatic cancer, no longer receiving cancer treatment, and recently referred to palliative care services in the UK.

study_goal: The researchers were investigating the association between sustained virological response (SVR) and insulin resistance (IR) in patients with chronic hepatitis C virus (HCV) genotypes 1 and 2/3, not specifically studying Alanine.
results_summary: The study found that SVR was associated with a significant reduction in HOMA-IR (a measure of insulin resistance) in patients with HCV genotype 1 but not in those with genotype 2/3. This suggests genotype 1 may have a direct effect on IR, independent of metabolic factors.
population_specificity: Treatment-naive patients with chronic HCV genotype 1 or 2/3 (n=2255, with paired HOMA-IR data in 1038 non-diabetic patients).
effective_dosage: Not specified (study compared albinterferon alpha-2b vs. pegylated interferon alpha-2a, not Alanine).
study_duration: 48 weeks for genotype 1, 24 weeks for genotype 2/3.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of BUP/NX, including its effects on alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels, in opioid-dependent injectors in China and Thailand.
results_summary: BUP/NX was well tolerated and effective in reducing opioid withdrawal symptoms, but 17% of subjects experienced grade 2 or 3 ALT increases, which were associated with baseline ALT elevation.
population_specificity: Chinese and Thai opioid-dependent injectors.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the antiviral effect of Peg-IFN plus ribavirin therapy in chronic hepatitis C patients with normal alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels versus those with elevated ALT levels.
results_summary: The study found that the sustained virological response (SVR) rates were equivalent between patients with normal and elevated ALT levels, though ALT elevation occurred post-treatment in approximately 40% of non-SVR patients with normal baseline ALT.
population_specificity: 386 chronic hepatitis C patients (193 with normal ALT, 193 with elevated ALT), including those with HCV genotype 1 and 2.

study_goal: The study aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of moxifloxacin, not Alanine, in treating community-acquired bacterial pneumonia.
results_summary: The study found significant improvements in clinical parameters and bacterial eradication with moxifloxacin treatment, but no results related to Alanine were reported.
population_specificity: 18 patients with community-acquired bacterial pneumonia.

study_goal: The researchers compared the safety, toxicity, and tumor response of conventional transarterial chemoembolization versus drug-eluting bead (DEB) transarterial chemoembolization in hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC), noting changes in alanine aminotransferase levels as a secondary outcome.
results_summary: The study found a significant increase in alanine aminotransferase levels 24 hours after treatment, which was greater after conventional chemoembolization than DEB chemoembolization. No other differences in liver toxicity were observed between the groups.
population_specificity: Patients with unresectable HCC unsuitable for ablative therapies (mean age 70 ± 7.7 years).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the clinical significance of serum DHEAS in patients with NAFLD, including its relationship with serum alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels.
results_summary: The study found that serum DHEAS levels were significantly higher in NAFLD patients, particularly those with elevated ALT levels. Serum ALT was positively correlated with serum DHEAS, triglycerides, and body mass index.
population_specificity: 158 Japanese men without viral hepatic diseases or excessive alcohol intake.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of aerobic training (AT), resistance training (RT), and their combination (AT/RT) on liver enzymes, including alanine aminotransferase, and other metabolic markers in overweight and sedentary individuals.
results_summary: AT significantly reduced liver fat, visceral fat, alanine aminotransferase, and insulin resistance (HOMA), while RT only reduced subcutaneous abdominal fat. AT was more effective than RT for improving visceral fat and liver-related markers, and the combination (AT/RT) showed effects similar to AT alone.
population_specificity: Overweight, sedentary adults (18-70 years old) with moderate dyslipidemia.
effective_dosage: Not applicable (exercise interventions, not alanine supplementation).

study_goal: The researchers sought to determine the effects of metformin on serum hepatic parameters, including alanine aminotransferase, in women with PCOS.
results_summary: The study found that metformin did not significantly change liver transaminase levels, including alanine aminotransferase, but the highest tertile of baseline levels showed the largest decrease regardless of treatment arm.
population_specificity: 626 infertile women with PCOS and mildly abnormal liver function parameters.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the activity and safety of ipilimumab in patients with metastatic uveal melanoma, including monitoring for adverse events such as alanine/aspartate aminotransferase elevation.
results_summary: The study found no objective responses in UM patients treated with ipilimumab, though some had stable disease. One patient experienced grade 3 alanine/aspartate aminotransferase elevation, which resolved with steroid therapy.
population_specificity: Thirteen pretreated patients with metastatic uveal melanoma from six European institutions.
effective_dosage: Induction treatment with ipilimumab 10 mg/kg, followed by maintenance doses at physicians' discretion.
study_duration: Tumor assessments were conducted at baseline, Week 12, Week 24, and Week 36.

study_goal: The study aimed to determine the maximum tolerated dose, pharmacokinetic/pharmacodynamic relationships, and clinical activity of pazopanib in patients with advanced hepatocellular carcinoma, not specifically Alanine.
results_summary: The study found dose-limiting toxicities at higher pazopanib doses, established 600 mg QD as the MTD, and observed reductions in tumor vessel leakage via DCE-MRI, but did not focus on Alanine's effects.
population_specificity: Asian patients with advanced hepatocellular carcinoma (Child-Pugh class A).
effective_dosage: Pazopanib doses ranged from 200-800 mg once daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of long-term interferon-alpha treatment on telomere length in peripheral blood T lymphocytes and its correlation with alanine aminotransferase levels in Hepatitis-C virus-infected subjects.
results_summary: The study found an inverse correlation between alanine aminotransferase levels and naïve CD8(+) T cell telomere loss in the control group but not in the interferon-alpha group. Telomere length at screening inversely correlated with Hepatitis-C viral load and body mass index.
population_specificity: 29 Hepatitis-C virus-infected subjects who failed to achieve a sustained virologic response after initial treatment.
study_duration: Additional 3.5 years after initial 24 weeks of treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether add-on adefovir (ADV) was a superior rescue strategy compared to switching to entecavir (ETV) for treating chronic hepatitis B (CHB) patients with lamivudine (LAM) resistance.
results_summary: The study found that LAM plus ADV combination therapy was more effective and produced longer-lasting effects than switching to ETV monotherapy, with faster and greater HBV DNA reduction rates at 24 weeks post-therapy. However, there were no statistical differences in virologic response, ALT normalization, and HBeAg seroconversion between the groups at 48 weeks.
population_specificity: Chronic hepatitis B (CHB) patients with lamivudine (LAM) resistance.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the intercorrelations between changes in biomarkers, including alanine aminotransferase, during a prolonged dietary intervention in obese participants with or without type 2 diabetes.
results_summary: The study found that in participants with type 2 diabetes, a decrease in fasting glucose was correlated with decreases in alanine aminotransferase, suggesting a potential link between glycemic control and liver enzyme levels.
population_specificity: Obese participants (BMI 31 kg/m²), including 46 with type 2 diabetes, average age 52 years.

study_goal: The study aimed to evaluate the long-term safety and tolerability of aripiprazole in pediatric subjects with autistic disorder, not specifically Alanine.
results_summary: The study found that aripiprazole was generally safe and well-tolerated, with common adverse events including weight increase and aggression. One patient discontinued due to moderately increased alanine transaminase and aspartate transaminase levels.
population_specificity: Pediatric subjects (6-17 years) with autistic disorder.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the hepatic effects of rosiglitazone/metformin (Rosi/Met) therapy on ALT levels, hepatic insulin sensitivity, and waist circumference in relation to type 2 diabetes prevention.
results_summary: Rosi/Met therapy lowered ALT levels in the first year and maintained this effect throughout the trial, but had no effect on central obesity and only a transient improvement in hepatic insulin sensitivity. The placebo arm showed no such benefits.
population_specificity: Subjects with impaired glucose tolerance (n = 207 total, 103 in Rosi/Met arm, 104 in placebo arm).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether ischaemic preconditioning (IPC) reduces liver damage, as measured by serum alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels, in patients undergoing major liver resection with intermittent vascular inflow occlusion.
results_summary: IPC did not reduce ALT levels or liver damage compared to the control group, with no significant difference in postoperative liver biochemistry tests between the groups.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing major liver resection with intermittent vascular inflow occlusion.
effective_dosage: Not applicable (IPC involved 10 min inflow occlusion followed by 10 min reperfusion).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the predictability of progression to a high-risk situation in women with gestational hypertension or mild pre-eclampsia at term, including the role of laboratory parameters like alanine aminotransferase.
results_summary: The study found that alanine aminotransferase was included in the final predictive model for progression to a high-risk situation, but its specific effects or efficacy were not detailed. The model's overall predictive accuracy was moderate (AUC 0.71).
population_specificity: Women with singleton pregnancies, cephalic presentation, 36–41 weeks gestation, and gestational hypertension or mild pre-eclampsia.

study_goal: The study aimed to compare the efficacy and tolerability of erlotinib versus standard chemotherapy in patients with advanced EGFR mutation-positive NSCLC, not specifically to evaluate alanine.
results_summary: The study found that erlotinib-treated patients had significantly longer progression-free survival compared to chemotherapy. Increased alanine aminotransferase concentrations were noted as a grade 3 or 4 toxic effect in 4% of erlotinib-treated patients.
population_specificity: Patients older than 18 years with histologically confirmed stage IIIB or IV NSCLC and a confirmed activating EGFR mutation (exon 19 deletion or exon 21 L858R point mutation).
effective_dosage: Not applicable (alanine was not a primary intervention).
study_duration: Erlotinib was administered until disease progression or unacceptable toxic effects; chemotherapy was up to four cycles.

study_goal: The researchers were evaluating the tolerability and clinical efficacy of oxaliplatin and pemetrexed as an induction chemotherapy regimen in locally advanced head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSCC), not specifically studying Alanine.
results_summary: The study reported predominantly grade 1 or 2 alanine aminotransferase/aspartate aminotransferase elevation as a side effect, but Alanine itself was not the focus of the research.
population_specificity: Patients with locally advanced head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSCC).
effective_dosage: Not applicable (Alanine was not a studied intervention).
study_duration: 4 cycles of chemotherapy administered every 14 days.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the efficacy and tolerance of tenofovir disoproxil fumarate (TDF) + emtricitabine (FTC) in patients with chronic hepatitis B (CHB), including its impact on alanine transaminase (ALT) levels.
results_summary: The study found that TDF + FTC showed strong antiviral efficacy, with 76% of patients achieving undetectable HBV-DNA at 48 weeks and 94% at 96 weeks. ALT levels remained stable, and no significant kidney function deterioration or viral breakthrough occurred.
population_specificity: 78 consecutive CHB patients from five European centers, classified into treatment intensification (69%) and treatment simplification (31%) groups.
study_duration: Median treatment duration was 76 weeks (interquartile range 60-116).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether albumin administration could be replaced by other volume replacement products (HES or LR) in hepatocellular carcinoma patients undergoing hepatectomy, focusing on hemodynamic stability, liver function, and inflammatory response.
results_summary: The study found that HA, HES, and LR achieved similar hemodynamic stability and liver function outcomes, with HES requiring less volume and showing a more favorable effect on the acute phase response (lower CRP).
population_specificity: Hepatocellular carcinoma patients undergoing hepatectomy.
effective_dosage: 20% human albumin (HA), 6% hydroxyethyl starch (HES), or lactated Ringer's solution (LR) for postoperative volume replacement.
study_duration: Postoperative days one, three, and five.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effectiveness of interferon-α 2b plus ribavirin treatment in chronic hepatitis C patients, with a focus on serum alanine transaminase (ALT) levels as a marker.
results_summary: The study found that 63.5% of patients responded to the treatment, with better outcomes observed in younger patients (≤40 years) and those with lower viral loads (<8×10^5 IU/ml). Serum ALT levels were quantified pre- and post-treatment, but specific effects of alanine were not detailed.
population_specificity: 750 HCV-positive patients with genotype 3 (616 completed treatment) in Pakistan, categorized by gender, age, and viral load.
effective_dosage: Interferon-α 2b (3 million units thrice weekly) plus ribavirin (1000-1200 mg daily).

study_goal: The researchers were investigating the clinical presentation and complications of Brucella suis infection in humans, particularly noting elevated alanine aminotransferase levels.
results_summary: The study found that Brucella suis infection led to significantly increased median alanine aminotransferase levels (20 times greater than normal), but without associated hepatic pathology. The clinical presentation and complications were similar to other Brucella species infections.
population_specificity: Patients in Wallis and Futuna Islands with Brucella suis infection (21 cases).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the association between antineoplastic treatment for childhood cancer and hepatic late adverse effects, particularly focusing on alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels.
results_summary: The prevalence of hepatic late adverse effects, defined as elevated ALT levels, ranged from 7.9% to 52.8% in selected studies. Chronic viral hepatitis was identified as a potential risk factor, but specific antineoplastic treatments linked to hepatic late adverse effects remain unclear.
population_specificity: Childhood cancer survivors (aged 18 years or less at diagnosis) with follow-up durations varying from one to 27 years after treatment.
study_duration: Follow-up ranged from one to 27 years after treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effectiveness and mechanism of ulinastatin (not Alanine) on liver function and clinical outcomes following hepatectomy.
results_summary: Ulinastatin significantly reduced serum alanine transaminase, aspartate transferase, inducible nitric oxide synthase, and tumor necrosis factor-α levels, delayed bilirubin response, and improved clinical outcomes, particularly after major hepatectomy. It also reduced hospital length of stay and recovery-related costs.
population_specificity: 176 patients undergoing hepatectomy (86 in treatment group, 90 in control group).

study_goal: The study aimed to investigate the efficacy and safety of gefitinib as a first-line treatment for elderly patients with advanced lung adenocarcinoma and EGFR mutations, not specifically focused on Alanine.
results_summary: The study found that gefitinib was effective (59% response rate) and well-tolerated in elderly patients with EGFR mutations, with major toxicities including skin rash and elevated liver enzymes (aspartate aminotransferase or alanine aminotransferase).
population_specificity: Elderly patients (aged 75 or older) with advanced lung adenocarcinoma and EGFR mutations.
study_duration: Until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify clinical predictors of severe pandemic H1N1 pneumonia and their correlation with radiological findings, including serum alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels.
results_summary: Higher serum ALT levels were associated with severe H1N1 pneumonia and positively correlated with radiological findings and the number of involved lung lobes.
population_specificity: Adults with pandemic H1N1 pneumonia (37 patients, 12 severe and 25 non-severe).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the antidiabetic activity of purslane seeds (Portulaca oleracea) in type-2 diabetic subjects, comparing its effects to metformin.
results_summary: PO seeds significantly reduced triglycerides, cholesterol, LDL, liver enzymes (ALT, AST, GGT), bilirubin, blood glucose, insulin, body weight, and BMI, while increasing HDL and albumin. The effects were comparable to metformin, except for HDL, LDL, and ALP patterns.
population_specificity: Thirty subjects with type-2 diabetes.
effective_dosage: 5 g of PO seeds twice daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare outcomes in HIV/HBV-coinfected participants using HBV-active versus non-HBV-active ART, including effects on alanine aminotransferase levels.
results_summary: HIV/HBV-coinfected participants had higher baseline alanine aminotransferase levels compared to monoinfected participants. Lamivudine-containing ART showed limited HBV DNA suppression (33%) and did not significantly reduce mortality in coinfected individuals.
population_specificity: HIV/HBV-coinfected adults in the PHIDISA II study.

study_goal: The researchers were evaluating the safety and efficacy of autologous DC-tumor vaccine therapy in patients with malignant glioma, noting transient elevations in AST/ALT levels (including alanine aminotransferase).
results_summary: The study found that 47.1% of patients experienced transient elevation in AST/ALT levels, but the DC-tumor vaccine therapy showed some tumor shrinkage, increased CD8(+) lymphocytes, and prolonged survival compared to historical controls.
population_specificity: Patients with malignant glioma (16 with WHO grade IV, 1 with grade III).
effective_dosage: Each injection contained 1-6×10^7 dendritic cells, administered 10 times over 6 months.

study_goal: The study aimed to assess the safety and efficacy of switching from enfuvirtide to raltegravir in patients with multidrug-resistant HIV infection, not specifically focused on Alanine.
results_summary: The study found that 18.2% of patients on raltegravir and ritonavir-boosted tipranavir experienced alanine aminotransferase elevations, leading to regimen adjustments in some cases. The abstract does not focus on Alanine's effects but mentions it as part of adverse event reporting.
population_specificity: Patients with multidrug-resistant HIV infection and suppressed plasma HIV RNA levels.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effect of HIV/AIDS on the pharmacokinetics of efavirenz, including the role of biochemical variables like alanine aminotransferase, in Ugandan patients.
results_summary: The study found that HIV/AIDS disease and sex significantly affect efavirenz pharmacokinetics, with HIV/AIDS patients showing reduced relative bioavailability and females having a higher volume of distribution and longer elimination half-life. Alanine aminotransferase was included as a covariate but its specific impact was not highlighted in the results.
population_specificity: Treatment-naïve HIV-infected Ugandan patients and adult healthy subjects.
study_duration: Blood samples collected up to 24 hours post-dose.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of thiazolidinediones on histological and biochemical variables, including alanine transaminase, in patients with non-alcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH).
results_summary: Thiazolidinediones modestly improved histological variables such as fibrosis, steatosis, inflammation, and hepatocellular ballooning but were associated with significant weight gain. The effect on alanine transaminase was noted as a secondary outcome, but specific results for alanine were not detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: Patients with non-alcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the longer-term effects and dose response of bardoxolone methyl on estimated GFR in patients with CKD and type 2 diabetes.
results_summary: Bardoxolone methyl significantly increased estimated GFR at 24 and 52 weeks compared to placebo, with dose-related effects. Adverse events included muscle spasms, hypomagnesemia, mild increases in alanine aminotransferase levels, and gastrointestinal effects.
population_specificity: Adults with CKD (estimated GFR 20-45 ml/min/1.73 m²) and type 2 diabetes.
effective_dosage: Target doses of 25, 75, or 150 mg once daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of pegIFNα-2a combined with ribavirin in treating hepatitis C virus in Egyptian children and adolescents, including monitoring serum alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels.
results_summary: The study found that 53.33% of patients achieved early virologic response (EVR), with serum ALT levels normalizing by week 12. Adverse effects included fever, myalgia, and hematologic changes, but no serious infections occurred.
population_specificity: Egyptian children and adolescents diagnosed with hepatitis C virus.
effective_dosage: pegIFNα-2a once weekly with ribavirin twice daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the long-term morbidity and mortality of patients with NAFLD and advanced fibrosis or cirrhosis to those with HCV infection, including the role of alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels in predicting outcomes.
results_summary: Lowered ALT levels in the NAFLD cohort were associated with liver-related complications, but the study did not focus on alanine as a supplement or its direct effects. The primary findings compared NAFLD and HCV outcomes, not alanine's efficacy or safety.
population_specificity: Patients with NAFLD or HCV infection and advanced fibrosis or cirrhosis (Child-Pugh class A).
study_duration: Mean follow-up of 85.6 months for NAFLD cohort, 74.9 months for HCV cohort.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the efficacy of intravenous glycyrrhizin (SNMC) in reducing alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels in patients with acute onset autoimmune hepatitis (AIH).
results_summary: The study found that early administration of SNMC effectively controlled ALT levels, with no significant difference compared to combined SNMC and corticosteroid therapy. Recovery rates were higher in the SNMC-only group, suggesting it may prevent disease progression in acute onset AIH.
population_specificity: 31 patients with acute onset autoimmune hepatitis (AIH).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether intraportal tacrolimus perfusion during liver transplantation could reduce ischaemic reperfusion injury, as assessed by AST and ALT levels.
results_summary: Tacrolimus treatment did not reduce AST or ALT levels within the first week post-transplantation but suppressed inflammation and immune response on a genome-wide basis. No differences were observed in cholestatic parameters or liver synthesis between groups.
population_specificity: 26 liver transplant recipients
effective_dosage: 20 ng/ml tacrolimus in 1.5 l 5% albumin infusion

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Arsenicum Album LM 0/3 could ameliorate arsenic toxicity symptoms in individuals exposed to contaminated drinking water.
results_summary: The study found that the homeopathic remedy slightly improved certain toxicity biomarkers, such as lowering matrix metalloproteinase activity, compared to placebo, but results were limited due to a high dropout rate.
population_specificity: Volunteers from an arsenic-contaminated village in West Bengal, India, with elevated arsenic levels in blood and urine.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of enteral nutrition (EN) and total parenteral nutrition (TPN) on biochemical and clinical outcomes, including alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels, in pancreatic cancer patients post-pancreaticoduodenectomy.
results_summary: The study found significant differences in ALT levels and other biochemical markers between EN and TPN groups by the 7th and 14th postoperative days, with EN showing better outcomes. EN also had lower incidences of complications like delayed gastric emptying, pancreatic fistulas, and hemorrhages compared to TPN.
population_specificity: 60 pancreatic cancer patients who underwent pancreaticoduodenectomy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether ischemic preconditioning (IP) combined with intermittent inflow occlusion improves outcomes in liver resections, focusing on markers like alanine aminotransferase (ALT) and local metabolic changes.
results_summary: IP did not reduce serum markers of ischemia-reperfusion injury (IRI) but improved local aerobic glucose metabolism (lower lactate, pyruvate, and glucose levels) in patients undergoing major liver resections. No differences were observed in ALT, AST, bilirubin, or PT-INR levels between groups.
population_specificity: Patients (n=32) with suspected malignant liver disease undergoing liver resections (minimum 2 segments), stratified by resection volume and without chronic liver disease.
effective_dosage: Not applicable (surgical intervention, not alanine supplementation).
study_duration: Patients were followed for 5 days postoperatively.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of combined pioglitazone and exenatide therapy versus pioglitazone alone on hepatic fat content and plasma adiponectin levels in patients with type 2 diabetes.
results_summary: Combined therapy significantly increased plasma adiponectin levels and reduced hepatic fat content more than pioglitazone alone, while also showing a greater decrease in alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels. Both treatments improved metabolic markers, but the combination was more effective without significant weight gain.
population_specificity: Patients with type 2 diabetes (age = 52 ± 3 years, BMI = 32.0 ± 1.5, HbA1c = 8.2 ± 0.4%) on diet and/or metformin.
effective_dosage: Pioglitazone 45 mg/day; exenatide 10 µg subcutaneously twice daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the relationships among hepatic steatosis, HCV RNA levels, relapse, and rapid virologic response (RVR) in patients with HCV genotype 2 or 3 treated with interferon-α, focusing on predictors like alanine aminotransferase levels.
results_summary: The study found that steatosis and high baseline HCV RNA levels were strong independent predictors of relapse in HCV genotype 3 patients with an RVR. Alanine aminotransferase levels were included in the multivariate analysis but were not highlighted as a primary predictor of outcomes.
population_specificity: Patients with chronic hepatitis C virus (HCV) genotype 2 (n = 427) or 3 (n = 505) infections.

study_goal: The study aimed to evaluate the safety, pharmacokinetics, pharmacodynamics, and efficacy of brivanib combined with cetuximab in patients with advanced gastrointestinal malignancies, not specifically Alanine.
results_summary: The study reported manageable toxicities and an overall response rate of 10% with brivanib plus cetuximab, but did not specifically assess Alanine's effects.
population_specificity: Patients with advanced gastrointestinal malignancies who had failed prior therapies.
effective_dosage: Not applicable (study focused on brivanib and cetuximab, not Alanine).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of alanine (control) and arginine on microcirculation in free transverse rectus abdominis myocutaneous flaps during breast reconstruction.
results_summary: Alanine was used as a control and showed lower microcirculatory blood flow in Zone IV postoperatively compared to arginine (p = 0.04), indicating it was less effective in improving microcirculation.
population_specificity: 20 patients undergoing unilateral breast reconstruction with free transverse rectus abdominis myocutaneous flaps.
effective_dosage: Continuous intravenous infusion (specific dosage not mentioned).

study_goal: The study aimed to evaluate baseline abdominal ultrasound findings in infants with sickle cell anemia and examine relationships among ultrasound results, clinical data, and laboratory findings, including serum alanine aminotransferase levels.
results_summary: The study found no correlation between biliary sonographic findings and laboratory results, including alanine aminotransferase levels. Increased renal volume correlated with elevated glomerular filtration rates, but spleen volume did not reflect function.
population_specificity: Infants (7.5-18 months) with sickle cell anemia (116 girls and 87 boys).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare postoperative early jaundice and transient liver damage in CABG patients receiving autologous or homologous blood transfusion, with a focus on liver enzyme levels including alanine transferase (ALT).
results_summary: The study found no significant changes in ALT levels between the ANH and control groups, suggesting no impact of transfusion type on ALT. However, bilirubin levels were significantly lower in the autologous transfusion group.
population_specificity: 40 patients scheduled for coronary artery bypass grafting (CABG) surgery.
study_duration: Measurements were taken within the first 24 hours post-surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the pharmacokinetics of vandetanib in Chinese patients with advanced solid tumors and compare these with data from Japanese and Western populations.
results_summary: The study found that vandetanib had low plasma clearance, a long half-life, and dose-dependent accumulation. Adverse events included rash and diarrhea, with one case of elevated alanine aminotransferase reported.
population_specificity: Chinese patients with advanced, solid, malignant tumors (age range 21-82 years, 56% male).
effective_dosage: 100 mg every other day, 100 mg once daily, or 300 mg once daily.
study_duration: Until disease progression or discontinuation in the study (minimum 28 days per cohort).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy, safety, and tolerability of tofacitinib (CP-690,550) in Japanese patients with active rheumatoid arthritis (RA) who had an inadequate response to methotrexate (MTX).
results_summary: Tofacitinib demonstrated significant efficacy in improving ACR20 response rates, with dose-dependent effects, and showed a manageable safety profile with mild to moderate adverse events, including increased alanine aminotransferase levels.
population_specificity: Japanese patients with active rheumatoid arthritis receiving stable background methotrexate.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify factors influencing basal insulin requirement in insulin-naïve patients with type 2 diabetes, including the role of alanine aminotransferase (ALT).
results_summary: The study found that alanine aminotransferase (ALT) was positively correlated with basal insulin requirement (γ=0.310, P=0.027) and identified ALT as an independent predictor of basal insulin requirement. However, the abstract does not detail specific effects of alanine itself.
population_specificity: 50 insulin-naïve patients with type 2 diabetes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the prevalence of HBV and HCV infections in an Italian cohort with type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) and assess the relationship between metabolic syndrome and liver enzyme levels, including alanine aminotransferase (ALT).
results_summary: The study found a non-negligible prevalence of HBV and HCV infections in T2DM patients, with higher liver enzyme levels in virus-positive cases. A positive correlation between BMI and ALT levels was observed only in virus-negative patients.
population_specificity: 859 consecutive patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus (413 females) from three Italian centers (Turin, Bologna, and Naples).

study_goal: The study aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of a combination therapy with gemcitabine and irinotecan as first-line chemotherapy in patients with advanced biliary tract cancer (BTC), not specifically focused on Alanine.
results_summary: The study found that the combination therapy had an objective response rate of 20.5% and a disease control rate of 66.7%, with median progression-free survival of 4.3 months and overall survival of 7.6 months. Grade 3 and 4 toxicities included alanine transaminase increase (5.1%) among other adverse effects.
population_specificity: Patients with pathologically confirmed advanced biliary tract cancer (intrahepatic bile duct cancer, extrahepatic bile duct cancer, and gallbladder cancer).
effective_dosage: Not applicable (study did not focus on Alanine supplementation).
study_duration: Median of 4 cycles per patient (range 1-18), with each cycle lasting 3 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to characterize the population pharmacokinetics of PM00104 (Zalypsis(®)) in cancer patients, including the effect of patient covariates on its pharmacokinetics.
results_summary: The study found that PM00104 exhibits linear elimination from plasma, dose proportionality up to 5,000 μg/m², and time-independent pharmacokinetics. No clinically relevant covariates were identified as predictors of its pharmacokinetics.
population_specificity: Cancer patients (135 participants across four phase I clinical trials).
effective_dosage: Doses ranged from 53 to 5,000 μg/m², administered as 1-, 3-, or 24-hour infusions every 3 weeks, or as 1-hour infusions on days 1, 8, and 15 of a 28-day cycle, or 1-hour infusions daily for 5 consecutive days every 3 weeks.
study_duration: Varied by dosing regimen (e.g., every 3 weeks, 28-day cycles, or 5 consecutive days every 3 weeks).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the association between serum alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels and the presence/severity of premature coronary artery disease (CAD).
